text:
Hello everyone! I want to integrate HubSpot and GastroPlanner (Restaurant booking mangement) I was wondering if the following is possible:

When a deal is set to closed won, I want it to automatically register as a booking in GastroPlanner w/ all the necessary

Is this possible with a simple API or do I need to go up in license such as Operation Hub?
Hi everyone! *is it possible to associate invoices (Quickbooks) with deals*? i saw the extension accounting API was deprecated, but wanted to know if there’s an alternative, cards maybe? Thaaanks!

Hello

Is this a good place to ask questions regarding API issues? I am using the HubSpot API to upload files. This works well for my account but not for my client's account. When I upload the file using my client's account HubSpot returns an error with this code, *FOLDER_DUPLICATE*. I am not seeing any information on this error code online. The error message is, *A folder already exists at this path*, which also doesn't help.

The API endpoint I am using is this one:
<https://api.hubapi.com/filemanager/api/v3/files/upload>

Help please!
How to create custom cards in the HubSpot API? Any ideas

When we create a new contact based on a new registered user, how can we add the tracked data to the contact, which was gathered from the JS script before the contact was created ? E.g. refering site, page views, etc.

You can't currently create a custom card using the api, you can create normal cards through developer accounts <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/custom-cards> or project based cards through the cli <https://app.HubSpot.com/docs/20472710/doc/platform/create-custom-crm-cards-with-projects>

I personally would suggest using the submit form api to create the contact and you can just provide the extra fields with the initial request <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>
And if that flow doesn't work for you, you can always update the contact with new information: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>
Ok
But how do we retrieve the tracked data from the JS tracker, so we can send it through the API ?
Which tracker are you using?
Only when the user is logged in, we set the email identifier.
So when the user is logged in, the page views are visible in the activity feed for that contact.
But it is important to also have the activity feed before the contact was created. E.g. referring website
Now it just displays: "This contact was created from Offline Sources from Integration"

has anyone developed a HubSpot serverless function / custom coded workflow setup that is a logger and error reporter? We can’t use something like <http://sentry.io|sentry.io> because of package limitations. I’m curious if anyone has done anything like this and would like to share their experience
Not going to say I have the best setup but it works, I have a axios function that posts to a lambda (which you can use <http://sentry.io|sentry.io> with) and then the lambda reports the error
Does /crm-object-schemas/v3/schemas/ changed to */crm/v3/schemas?*
I don't think it ever was crm-object-schemas
Hey <@U01QVR44MEY> Is not possible to create schemas using oauth?

Well, there is a scope that can be used in OAuth for custom schema creation, but it's under a pilot program and only available if the HubSpot app quality team approves your request.  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/custom-objects-schema-pilot>
Yep just like <@U03RVAH50TY> said
Thanks people

With a custom module when I am searching a record the api is not returning all the custom properties, just the HubSpot created properties and one custom property.

Is there a setting I need to change to get all the custom properties in the custom module to be returned in the simplepublicobject response?

```  SimplePublicObject {
    id: '1234567890',
    properties: {
      hs_createdate: '2022-12-01T13:51:57.945Z',
      hs_lastmodifieddate: '2022-12-08T20:01:32.567Z',
      hs_object_id: '1234567890',
      custom_field: 'Value'
      should be another 6 properties here
    },
    createdAt: 2022-09-09T13:51:57.945Z,
    updatedAt: 2022-12-08T20:01:32.567Z,
    associations: undefined,
    archived: false,
    archivedAt: undefined
  }```
Is it possible to create a note on a ticket (associated to a ticket) in a single API call?

:wave: Could someone please confirm that it’s not possible to update the “marketing contact status” field on a contact via the API (after the contact has been created)? I see this <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Please-allow-marketing-contact-status-to-be-updated-via-API/idi-p/401913|feature request> has been open for almost 2 years.
Currently no, you need to create the note (engagement) and then associate it to the ticket
Thanks! :neutral_face:
of course
